reviews.review: Graphics are still good for modern day and the puzzles are a hoot :D

I tried to like it, I really did. But it's just so boring. The levels are extraordinarily linear with no variation - kill soldiers, maybe a gunship here and there, and solve a "puzzle." The total time spent on the story has to be less than 30 minutes. Whenever you start getting story/dialogue, it's over in a couple minutes and it's back to the same old shooting and running down corridors. The "secrets" are boring and just give you ammo or health.  I really don't get why people hold this is such high regard.
One of the best games i've ever played

Rise and shine, Mister Freeman. Rise and shine. Not that I wish to imply you have been sleeping on the job. No one is more deserving of a rest... and all the effort in the world would have gone to waste until... well, let's just say your hour has come again. The right man in the wrong place can make all the difference in the world. So, wake up, Mister Freeman. Wake up and smell the ashes...
it has aged like fine wine

A staple and innovator of the FPS genre, I've replayed it countless times and it never feels stale or boring. there really isn't much to say as it speaks for itself, a classic and riveting game that stands the test of time and offers a memorable experience that leaves you feeling eager for more, lets just hope we'll actually get a 3rd installment of the series...
I admire the way this game implemented now-common design techniques. A very immersive experience with a versatile physics system. Worth the 10 bucks.

Black mesa gave me the chance to to experience Half life 1. Which in turn allowed me to experience Half life 2. Even if Half life 2 feels a bit outdated compared to Black Mesa and modern games in general, it still has a lot going for it even today.

Let me first start with the outdated stuff. The AI in this game is super simple, to the point where some encounters feel really boring and slow. Some sections also feel like they drag out their mechanic a bit too long, for example some vehicle sections made me wonder if I went the wrong way due to how ridiculously long they last. And the physics in this game can be really messy, most of the time they are fine but I have had the game spaz out to the point of killing me.

Now onto the more positive stuff: The overall story is still really intriguing. Episode one and two of Half life 2 are both really fun and especially episode two is so good that I would say its worth experiencing the first parts to really get the full experience out of episode two. The physics might spaz out but they are still really interesting and fun, its just fun to play the game and see what you can do with certain objects. Maps give you quite a lot of freedom in how you explore and look for loot. And lastly the world itself is really fun to explore, there are a lot more locations compared to Half life 1 and they all have really interesting but smaller story lines going on.

Overall its still well worth it to experience this game. Its fun, super cheap and its a really nice way to experience gaming history.
Old but gold. One of the best FPS games out there. Valve don't make games like this anymore... T_T

A masterpiece in level design, This is my most favorite game. It also has a high re-play value, you basically never get bored of it no matter how many times you played it. For a game from 2004 it aged so well and the graphics don't feel outdated whatsoever. I highly recommend it.
Any Valve game is a 10/10 for me, get em all.
absolute masterpiece, truly a good game
Great game. Too bad Valve can't count to three...
